author: Mary Walrath-Holdridge
title: Kathleen Wilson's Minnesota dentist did 30 procedures at once: lawsuit
text: 20 fillings, 4 root canals, 8 crowns in one visit add up to lawsuit for Minnesota dentist [Mary Walrath-Holdridge](https://www.usatoday.com/staff/12093029002/mary-walrathholdridge/) A Minnesota dentist has become the subject of a malpractice lawsuit after his patient accused him of "disfiguring" her. The civil lawsuit was filed in Hennepin County, Minnesota last week by Kathleen Wilson, who alleged Dr. Kevin Molldrem and [Molldrem Family Dentistry](https://molldremdentistry.com/) caused her significant injury that is still being corrected. According to the suit, Molldrem performed more than 30 producers on Wilson in a single July 2020 visit, doing eight crowns, four root canals and 20 fillings in one go. The lawsuit alleges that the dentist "perform[ed] this work improperly," resulting in pain and suffering, embarrassment, emotional distress, and disfigurement. Molldrem was likewise accused of using improper levels of anesthesia during the procedures and falsifying medical records to cover it up. Treatment called 'inconceivable' “It is inconceivable that Dr. Molldrem could have prepared and placed 8 crowns under these circumstances in the time allotted, not to mention the additional 20 restorations,” wrote [Dr. Avrum Goldstein,](https://www.seakexperts.com/members/4827-avrum-r-goldstein) a dentist and expert witness brought on by Wilson's attorney, in an affidavit. Goldstein, who is a faculty member at [NOVA Southeastern University](https://dental.nova.edu/aboutus/faculty/goldstein-avrum%20.html?_gl=1*1kqtqxq*_gcl_au*ODA4NzUxNTA1LjE3MDM3OTc5MjI.), also wrote that Wilson had been correctly diagnosed as having a "rare condition" causing decay in almost all of her teeth, but Mollderm's course of action was not a proper form of treatment. "[Wilson’s] required a slow, thoughtful, careful and measured response to her disease,” he said in his report. “Trying to fill every hole in every tooth in her mouth in one visit is not only the antithesis of what was indicated, it is not humanly possible to achieve in an effective or constructive manner.” Doctors remove wrong organ from man: [They opened him up to remove his appendix. They mistakenly took out much more, lawsuit says.](/story/news/health/2023/11/07/doctors-accidentally-remove-wrong-organ-surgery/71487292007/) The lawsuit also accused Mollderm of tampering with medical records to falsify the amount of anesthesia that was reportedly used, which in reality was nearly double the standard number of units, according to court paperwork. According to Goldstein, the maximum dose of anesthesia given in three hours should not exceed 490 mg, but Molldrem's records show he gave Wilson 960 mg. “Any negative cardiovascular or central nervous system outcomes could be tied to the local anesthetic overdose," he wrote. Wilson said in the suit that she has since had to have the dental work completely redone by other dentists to repair Molldrem’s “negligent work," an ongoing process that has caused her to lose income and rack up medical bills on top of enduring pain, suffering and embarrassment. She is seeking more than $50,000 in damages. Wilson's attorney and Molldrem did not immediately respond to request for comment.

author: Opinion by Chris Knopf Today
title: Local View: If you love the Boundary Waters, stop Project 2025
text: From the column: "We stand at a critical juncture. The choices we make now could determine the fate of the Boundary Waters." Back in January, I wrote out a list of goals and projects to complete in 2024. Amid the humdrum litany of house repairs, my list included something of much greater and lasting appeal: paddle the entire length of the Boundary Waters Canoe Area Wilderness from west to east along the historic Voyageur’s Highway that extends for 200 miles along the Canadian border. A few weeks ago, I completed this 2024 project of mine, starting at Crane Lake just west of the BWCAW and dropping my canoe into Lake Superior a week and half later. Time in the wilderness has many virtues, including simplifying life and clarifying priorities. My 11-day paddle had this effect on me. I returned from the Boundary Waters wilderness of crystal-clear lakes and towering pines renewed and refreshed. It also became clear to me during my time in the wilderness that, while the Boundary Waters is protected, it is far from safe. For over a century, generation after generation has had to stand up to protect this area. Roads, mining, logging, and other forms of irresponsible development have all threatened the Boundary Waters. Now, for well over a decade, we have been caught in a fight against proposed copper-sulfide mining at the edge of the wilderness. Operating one of these mines, which the EPA has listed as the most polluting industry in the country, close to a water-rich area like the Boundary Waters threatens an ecological — and human — disaster. ADVERTISEMENT The water level was very high during my time in the Boundary Waters, and the water was constantly moving over rapids and waterfalls and also through narrows where the water typically would not be visibly moving. The lakes, rivers, and streams are all interconnected. This very fact makes the Boundary Waters and the surrounding landscape uniquely vulnerable to copper-sulfide mining. The pollution from copper-sulfide mining would not stay still. Just as water flows throughout the Boundary Waters wilderness through a maze of lakes, rivers, and streams, so, too, could acid runoff from copper-sulfide mining flow through this intricate network of waterways, polluting countless acres of once-pristine water. Well, it turns out that I am not the only one who developed a project list. The Heritage Foundation, a conservative think tank in Washington, D.C., prepared a blueprint for a next Donald Trump presidential administration, called Project 2025. On page 523, it calls for eliminating the current 20-year ban on copper-sulfide mining on approximately 225,000 acres of federal land near the Boundary Waters. This would clear the way for dangerous copper-sulfide mining projects that could pollute the wilderness. Although former President Trump has clumsily sought to distance himself from Project 2025, in his recent visit to Minnesota he stated he would remove this protection for the wilderness “in about 10 minutes.” The promised attacks on the Boundary Waters from Project 2025 and Trump are not isolated. There is a multi-prong effort to dismantle the protection of the Boundary Waters. Congressman Pete Stauber introduced a bill that would overturn the 20-year ban on copper-sulfide mining near the Boundary Waters and reinstate mineral leases to foreign mining conglomerates like the owners of Twin Metals, which have aggressively sought to open a toxic copper-sulfide mine at the edge of the BWCAW. Stripping away these crucial protections could be catastrophic for one of America's most cherished wild places. The Boundary Waters is more than just a recreational area; it's a national treasure that belongs to all Americans. Its value lies not just in its natural resources but in its ability to provide solace, adventure, and connection to nature. The Boundary Waters, as we know it, did not just happen. It took generations of people to stand up to logging and mining interests and to speak up for the people who have been touched by this special place. If we fail to continue this legacy, the Boundary Waters could be lost. We stand at a critical juncture. The choices we make now could determine the fate of the Boundary Waters. Project 2025 poses a dangerous step backward, one that could lead to the irreversible destruction of this unique wilderness. Let’s add to our project list to stop Project 2025 from being implemented. ADVERTISEMENT Chris Knopf is executive director of the nonprofit, St. Paul-based Friends of the Boundary Waters (friends-bwca.org). ADVERTISEMENT

author: hdgsylvester
title: Eucalyptus Silk Sheets: The Perfect Bedding Choice for All Seasons
text:
When it involves choosing the right bedding, discovering a fabric that keeps you comfortable in all seasons will be challenging. The market is filled with options, from cotton to linen to artificial fibers, each with its own pros and cons. But lately, a new contender has emerged as a popular selection for these seeking comfort, sustainability, and year-round usability: eucalyptus silk sheets. Known for their luxurious feel, eco-friendly production, and temperature-regulating properties, eucalyptus silk sheets are quickly changing into a favorite. Here’s why these sheets are the perfect bedding alternative for all seasons.
1. What Are Eucalyptus Silk Sheets?
Eucalyptus silk sheets, also known as Tencel or lyocell sheets, are made from the fibers of eucalyptus trees. The term “silk” in their name refers to their luxurious softness, often compared to traditional silk. Unlike silk derived from silkworms, eucalyptus silk is vegan and plant-based, making it an interesting option for those looking for cruelty-free bedding options.
These sheets are produced through an eco-friendly process. Eucalyptus timber, which grow quickly and require little water, are harvested and broken down into pulp. This pulp is then transformed into fiber utilizing a closed-loop production technique, which implies that practically all of the solvents and water used within the process are recycled, minimizing environmental impact.
2. Temperature Regulation: Stay Cool within the Summer season, Warm in the Winter
One of the standout qualities of eucalyptus silk sheets is their distinctive temperature-regulating ability. This is because of the natural properties of eucalyptus fibers, which wick moisture away from the skin while allowing for airflow. This makes eucalyptus silk sheets a wonderful choice for warm weather, as they keep you cool and dry by drawing heat away out of your body and promoting breathability.
In colder months, eucalyptus silk sheets also provide a comfortable sleeping experience. While they don’t trap heat the way flannel or fleece may, they offer a gentle, insulating impact that keeps your body warmth in balance without overheating. The end result? Sheets that adapt to the climate, helping you sleep soundly regardless of the season.
3. Hypoallergenic and Antibacterial Properties
Eucalyptus silk sheets are usually not only comfortable but also beneficial for folks with sensitive skin or allergies. Eucalyptus fibers have natural hypoallergenic and antibacterial properties, making them immune to dust mites, mold, and bacteria. This is a significant advantage for anyone prone to allergic reactions or sensitive to traditional cotton sheets that can trap allergens.
The hypoallergenic properties of eucalyptus silk sheets extend beyond seasonal changes. Whether it’s pollen in the spring or dry air within the winter, these sheets supply a cleaner, safer sleeping environment yr-round. And because they are resistant to odor and bacteria, you’ll find that eucalyptus silk sheets keep fresher longer, reducing the need for frequent washing and extending the lifetime of your bedding.
4. Softness and Comfort That Lasts
One other reason eucalyptus silk sheets have gained popularity is their luxurious softness, which rivals that of high-quality cotton or silk sheets. They have a smooth, silky texture that is gentle on the skin, reducing friction and offering a soothing feel. This quality makes them an excellent alternative for those with sensitive skin or anyone who enjoys the texture of high-end bedding.
What’s more, eucalyptus silk sheets maintain their softness and durability over time. Unlike some cotton sheets that can turn out to be tough after a number of washes, eucalyptus silk sheets remain smooth, reducing pilling and wear. With proper care, they can last for years, making them a worthwhile investment in long-term comfort.
5. An Eco-Friendly Alternative for Conscious Consumers
For these concerned with environmental impact, eucalyptus silk sheets are a responsible choice. Eucalyptus bushes develop quickly and will be cultivated sustainably with minimal water. Furthermore, the production process of eucalyptus silk is environmentally aware, utilizing fewer chemical substances and less water than cotton or traditional silk production.
Many corporations that manufacture eucalyptus silk sheets are additionally committed to sustainable practices, ensuring that their products are ethically made and free of harmful chemicals. While you select eucalyptus silk sheets, you’re not only opting for comfort and quality but also supporting a product that aligns with eco-friendly values.
6. Easy Care and Upkeep
While eucalyptus silk sheets may sound like they require particular care as a result of their luxurious texture, they are surprisingly straightforward to maintain. These sheets can typically be machine washed on a gentle cycle with cold water and mild detergent. They dry quickly and resist wrinkles, making them low-maintenance compared to traditional silk or high-thread-depend cotton sheets that may need ironing or special attention.
7. The Verdict: Eucalyptus Silk Sheets for Each Season
Eucalyptus silk sheets provide a uncommon combination of comfort, sustainability, and adaptability that makes them very best for year-spherical use. Whether you’re looking to stay cool throughout hot summer nights or cozy up within the winter, these sheets provide the right balance. Their hypoallergenic, antibacterial, and moisture-wicking properties contribute to a healthier sleeping environment, while their silky-soft texture ensures an opulent really feel each night.
For anybody seeking a high-quality, eco-friendly alternative to traditional bedding materials, eucalyptus silk sheets are well worth the investment. Not only do they provide unparalleled comfort, but in addition they align with environmentally conscious values, making them a smart choice for all seasons. So, when you’re ready to elevate your bedding expertise, consider giving eucalyptus silk sheets a strive—you would possibly just discover that they’re the proper addition to your sleep routine, regardless of the weather.
In the event you loved this post and you want to receive more information with regards to vegan silk sheets i implore you to visit the web-site.

author: Michael Broomhead
title: Pictures show amazing lightning over Bradford district | Bradford Telegraph and Argus
text:
THE sky put on quite a show across the Bradford area last night.
Shortly after 8pm, a number of lightning strikes dazzled the district .
Syeed Hussain's picture shows the lightning in Bradford's skies (Image: T&A Camera Club)
Martin Berry took this in Riddlesden (Image: T&A Camera Club)
Many of our readers were wowed by the sight and submitted some amazing pictures of the bolts via the Telegraph & Argus Camera Club Facebook page and our Send us your News page .
Reece Horgan in Allerton shared this picture with us (Image: Submitted)
Craig Lindsey's picture shows the lightning in Shipley (Image: Submitted)
One Bradford resident counted three strikes - one of which was powerful enough to shake houses.
Submitted by Paul Dalton (Image: T&A Camera Club)
Submitted by Carlos Conwaz (Image: T&A Camera Club)
"I have never heard thunder like it, our house literally shook," said a resident from Tyersal.
"It was like we were at the centre of the storm.
"It was pitch black until the lightning lit the sky up."
Other residents remarked on how unusual it was to see lightning during the winter months.
Thank you to everyone who sent us their photos.
Camera Club Weather Bradford Keighley

author: RAC
title: El PP acusa al Concello de verter durante años residuos «sin control» en A Feira Nova
text:
El PP acusa al Concello de verter durante años residuos «sin control» en A Feira Nova
Critica el depósito «incontrolado» de restos de obra, mobiliario y hasta coches
El PP de Betanzos ha denunciado ante las «administraciones con competencias sobre el medio natural y sanitario» el uso que hace el Concello desde hace años de una parcela municipal de A Feira Nova en la que deposita «sin ningún tipo de control».
Los populares afirman que esta finca se ha convertido «de facto» en un «vertedero incontrolado al que van a parar elementos del mobiliario urbano, escombros de obras e incluso vehículos, considerados por ley residuos peligrosos».
«Es un espacio en pendiente y cuando llueve se general lixiviados que terminan circulando calles abajo y llegan a los ríos», denuncia la formación en un comunicado de prensa.

author: lcamargo
title: Yuri Alberto celebra publicação no perfil da Copa do Mundo
text:
Corinthians Em alta no Corinthians, Yuri Alberto celebra após perfil da Copa do Mundo publicar seu gol Na terça-feira o perfil oficial da Copa do Mundo no Instagram fez uma publicação envolvendo Yuri Alberto Por Lorena Camargo
19/03/2025 - 19:57hs BRT
Atacante celebra moral de perfil da Copa do Mundo Na última terça-feira (18), quando Yuri Alberto completou 24 anos, o perfil oficial da Copa do Mundo no Instagram publicou o único gol do camisa 9 do Corinthians na edição de 2017 do Mundial Sub-17.
© Marcello Zambrana/AGIF Yuri Alberto jogador do Corinthians comemora seu gol – Foto: Marcello Zambrana/AGIF Com a homenagem publicada na data de seu aniversário, o atacante do Timão revelou que ficou emocionado com a postagem e projetou que o vídeo servirá como motivação.
Yuri Alberto projeta importância do gol publicado “ É gratificante ser lembrado pela Fifa no dia do meu aniversário. Não estava esperando, e isso me emocionou bastante. Aquele gol foi muito importante para mim. Foi na Copa do Mundo da Índia, e tinha 16 anos, era um moleque. Hoje, com 24 anos, posso dizer que tudo valeu a pena. Ter me dedicado desde cedo, ter batalhado, abdicado de coisas que todo adolescente gosta de fazer, isso me fez chegar onde cheguei. “ , iniciou o camisa 9.
PUBLICIDADE PUBLICIDADE “E eu quero muito mais. A camisa que eu visto me exige e me impulsiona para isso. As conquistas, os números, os recordes, como o de maior artilheiro sub-23 do mundo, edificam essa versão que sou hoje, mas é sempre o próximo desafio que me move”, acrescentou Yuri.
“Quero marcar meu nome na história do Corinthians , quero ser sempre opção para a Seleção Brasileira . Estou no auge da minha carreira e espero elevar meu nível técnico, físico e mental a cada dia. É uma felicidade muito grande fazer aniversário e perceber que tenho desempenhado um bom papel “, finalizou o atacante .
Yuri Alberto comemora seu gol durante partida contra o Palmeiras – Foto: Marcello Zambrana/AGIF
PUBLICIDADE PUBLICIDADE Corinthians rumo ao 31º título do Campeonato Paulista No sábado (15), o Atlético-MG se consagrou campeão estadual de 2025, já no último domingo (16) o Flamengo e o Internacional também tiveram a mesma honra.
Mesmo com o fim do Campeonato Gaúcho , Carioca e Mineiro , a disputa no Estadual de São Paulo continua. E a grande final já tem data marcada para acontecer.
Veja também
Corinthians é o único time da Série A com mais de 90% de público nos estaduais
O jogo de volta válido pela final decisiva do Paulistão , está marcado para o dia 27 de março, na Neo Química Arena. Onde o Corinthians chega com 1 gol de vantagem feito por Yuri Alberto para enfrentar o Palmeiras em casa.
PUBLICIDADE PUBLICIDADE Lorena Camargo é uma profissional apaixonada por esportes, com grande foco em acompanhamento e análise das principais competições esportivas, especialmente de futebol. Sua dedicação ao universo futebolístico a leva a produzir conteúdo de qualidade que conecta e informa os fãs. Atualmente no Bolavip Brasil, seu compromisso é entregar conteúdo relevante e de alto nível para um público engajado e apaixonado.
